mods.abstract: Statue of Sheykh-el-Beled (Old Kingdom, Dynasty IV) at the Boulaq Museum; life-size sycamore statue of lector priest Ka-aper found in his mastaba tomb at Saqqara, west of the pyramid of Pharaoh Userkaf; statue carved in realistic style depicting a fleshy man with eyes inlaid with semi-precious stones; originally named by Egyptian workers who named it after their village leader; legs and staff are modern additions; untitled print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
